sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>sake</radical> radical and the <kanji>sake</kanji> kanji are exactly the same! Sweet.
meaningInfo: For goodness sake! Please remember this isn't "sake" as in <ja>お酒</ja>! It's the English "sake," that rhymes with "bake," "cake," and "steak." Oops.. now I'm hungry.
readingMnemonic: For the <kanji>sake</kanji> of convenience, companies will use <reading>ea</reading>gles (<ja>い</ja>) for delivery jobs in the future. Just put in an order, and it'll be at your doorstep in no time flat. Eagles are like, super fast at delivery.
readingInfo: See this eagle as it comes to deliver your order just for your sake. Scree! Hear its wings flap and your package plop down on your porch as it's delivered.
